cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to turn northwest and then north, tracking across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle / Alabama coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (near the FL Panhandle–AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning limited to the Florida Keys – none posted for Georgia coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from the Seven-Mile Bridge westward to Dry Tortugas (Florida Keys)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, eastern Gulf of Mexico, Florida Panhandle, Alabama coast, and inland southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Tuesday with winds generally below tropical-storm force; peak gusts 25–35 mph
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat expected on the Georgia Atlantic coast from a Gulf-side landfalling system
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts, creating localized ponding and minor flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado risk in outer rain bands and increased rip-current risk along nearby beaches
